text: hello everyone I'm Robin and in this
video I'm gonna talk about some culture
shock experience I had when I first came
to Korea now when I first came to Korea
I used to teach adults I used to teach
adults conversational English and I had
one class with about eight adults and
they were different ages youngest was a
university student and he was around 22
and the oldest student was a woman and
she was about 60 and she was studying
English because she had to go to Canada
a few months later to meet her
grandchildren who lived in Canada so she
wanted to practice some conversational
English anyway one day I was teaching
the class something I don't remember but
I do remember everyone needed a pen okay
and all of the students had a pen except
the old woman she didn't have a pen so
you know I'm a kind teacher and I had an
extra pen so I thought I'll give her my
pen so she was a little bit far from me
so I just kind of leaned over and I
threw my pen and it landed on her desk
you know I didn't really strongly throw
my pen just lightly through my pen after
I threw my pen everyone was quiet
okay the atmosphere and the classroom
changed a lot and I was confused you
know what's going on because everyone
just seemed shocked they were quiet
after the class one of the students came
up to me and said Robin you made a
really big mistake today I was like what
what happened he said do you remember
when you threw the pen at the old lady
and I said yeah he said never do that
okay you can't do that in Korea and he
explained the proper way you should
always use two hands when you give
something to an older person so I was
very thankful for him for explaining
that to me and I was very sorry to that
old lady because I just threw the pen
rudely
I didn't know I was new to Korea anyway
that's my culture shark story I hope you
enjoyed it see you next time
